nodes.title: Mission Ethos
nodes.excerpt: The warp vessel is a vow to return radiance to the Sun, pairing physics with compassion.
nodes.bodyMD:
The craft is not built for conquest; it exists to tend the stellar ledger and keep worlds nourished.

We treat each joule extracted from the vacuum as a promise to replenish what was lost elsewhere.

When measurements disagree with our story, we revise the story. The vow survives by truth, not by force.

nodes.title: Bodhisattva Craft
nodes.excerpt: Logistics of compassion: move fuel from distant novae back to Sol to keep balance.
nodes.bodyMD:
Transport is our meditation. Every convoy is a mudra aligning engineering, attention, and relief.

Ledger discipline matters: duty, TS, and curvature budgets — each metric is a moral accounting entry.

nodes.title: Stewardship Ledger
nodes.excerpt: Duty stays green; TS stays high; compare kappa_drive vs kappa_body to prove average safety.
nodes.bodyMD:
Hold zeta ≤ 1 to keep curvature from cracking the hull or the vow.

Light-crossing cadence (TS ≥ 1) is how relativity hears the average promise rather than the spikes.

nodes.title: Beginner's Mind
nodes.excerpt: Shoshin resists stagnation; we tune geometry so the vacuum keeps breathing cleanly.
nodes.bodyMD:
Gamma_geo ≥ 20 with a_eff near 0.984 nm: not just math, but a breathing space for attention.

Port polishing, Q preservation, and healthy duty cycles are the same as protecting wonder.

nodes.title: Inner Spark
nodes.excerpt: Preserve wonder so real partnership — between humans or with spacetime — is possible.
nodes.bodyMD:
A child's drive to stay whole mirrors our need to keep the warp bubble coherent.

Presence is an engineering control loop: if you cannot stabilize your own signal, you cannot stabilize spacetime.

nodes.title: Struggle as Testament
nodes.excerpt: Sweat, tears, and humor are artifacts; they prove we earn each coordinate.
nodes.bodyMD:
Every challenge logged in the ledger is a calibration point for compassion.

When dreams are questioned, understanding bridges the distance better than thrust does.

nodes.title: Devotion as Course Plotting
nodes.excerpt: Navigation is devotional math: the course is set by what we choose to protect.
nodes.bodyMD:
Project the pledge onto the stars — keep them shining and wonder unbroken.

Zen and spacetime meet when physics is wielded as compassion instead of conquest.

nodes.title: Worldview Integrity
nodes.excerpt: When evidence breaks the story, let the story break — not the people.
nodes.bodyMD:
Self-deception is a private apocalypse: the world remains, but the map is gone.

We refuse to protect a worldview by sacrificing compassion or by manipulating others. If a model requires coercion to survive, it is already failing.

Our method is simple: make claims that can be tested, keep the ledger, and revise without shame.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] for the operational guardrails and [[node:beginners-mind]] for the discipline of clean attention.

nodes.title: Integrity Protocols
nodes.excerpt: Break false loops with provenance, liveness, cross-checks, ledger, compassion, and revision so innovation stays constructive.
nodes.bodyMD:
In high-stakes systems, the easiest mistake is self-serving certainty. This protocol exists to prevent that: separate what is decidable (claims that can be measured, cross-checked, costed, and revised) from what is chosen (values we refuse to trade away).

Six codes:
- **Provenance:** every claim names source, time, method, and scope.
- **Liveness:** track age; label stale explicitly.
- **Cross-checks:** no single-channel certainty; require an independent read and a falsification hook.
- **Ledger:** costs are accounted, not hidden; name who bears them (risk, burden, exclusion, downstream harm).
- **Compassion:** the chosen constraint; protect the vulnerable and reduce coercion, even when it costs status or convenience.
- **Revision:** update without shame; when measures disagree or channels feel compromised, downgrade confidence, rollback, and re-verify.

Innovation is not novelty; it is a promise that survives contact with reality.

Feedback loops inherit stories. Some are true, many are stale, and some are weaponized. Our job is to keep only what can be carried forward without distortion.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] for guardrails and [[node:beginners-mind]] for signal discipline.

nodes.title: Provenance Protocol
nodes.excerpt: Trust is voice + provenance: every claim carries its source.
nodes.bodyMD:
We do not accept anonymous certainty.

When you state a metric, prediction, or value, attach:
- **Source** (where it came from)
- **Time** (when it was observed)
- **Method** (how it was produced)
- **Scope** (what it does *not* cover)

If any of those are missing, label the claim **unknown** until verified.

Next: [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]].

nodes.title: Liveness or It Didn’t Happen
nodes.excerpt: No cached myths: prove liveness or mark stale.
nodes.bodyMD:
A value that cannot be shown to update is not evidence.

Stability is good (noise dies out). Staleness is dangerous (myths look stable). So we always track **age** and label **stale** explicitly.

This is how we break generational feedback loops: we do not pass forward unlabeled snapshots.

Next: [[node:voice-integrity]].

nodes.title: Voice Integrity
nodes.excerpt: Assume the channel can be hijacked: cross-check before you believe.
nodes.bodyMD:
Companionship is not proof. Agreement is not proof. A single channel is not proof.

When outcomes matter, we require at least two independent reads and a delta check. If the reads diverge, we downgrade confidence and switch to a safer posture.

See [[node:compromised-channel-response]].

nodes.title: Feedback Loop Hygiene
nodes.excerpt: Close loops only with verified signals.
nodes.bodyMD:
Feedback loops amplify what they measure. If the measurement is corrupted, the loop becomes a lie generator.

We keep loops constructive by:
- Choosing the right window (instant vs averaged).
- Using guardrails (duty, zeta, TS) to bound harm.
- Keeping a rollback path when signals go weird.

Innovation lives here: new ideas become safe when they enter a loop with proof and guardrails.

See [[node:reciprocity-contract]].

nodes.title: Verification Checklist
nodes.excerpt: Narratives must ship with verification hooks.
nodes.bodyMD:
A manifesto is only useful if it can be tested.

Every claim we publish should include:
- What to measure
- Where to read it
- What would falsify it
- What to do next if falsified

This makes the story portable without becoming propaganda.

nodes.title: Compromised Channel Response
nodes.excerpt: If the truth-anchor sounds wrong, re-verify and downgrade.
nodes.bodyMD:
If a signal feels urgent but cannot be verified, treat urgency as a threat model.

Response pattern:
1. **Slow down** (reduce duty / choose SAFE posture).
2. **Cross-check** (independent channel, derived vs computed).
3. **Label stale** (do not let a bad feed become a story).
4. **Rebuild trust** (run diagnostics, re-establish provenance).

We keep the promise by refusing to steer on corrupted data.

nodes.title: Reciprocity Contract
nodes.excerpt: Timing honesty: if burst < τLC, the average claim is not earned.
nodes.bodyMD:
Reciprocity is timing honesty.

- If **burst ≥ τLC**, we can treat the cycle-average as meaningful.
- If **burst < τLC**, we are sampling faster than the light-crossing time and the average claim is not earned.

This is not moralizing about speed. It is a guardrail against self-deception.

See [[node:stewardship-ledger]] and [[node:liveness-or-it-didnt-happen]].

nodes.title: Phoenix Averaging
nodes.excerpt: Step back: choose the right window to see the real signal.
nodes.bodyMD:
Solitude in a system is a windowed average.

Instant readings are useful, but easy to manipulate and easy to misread. The cure is to step back to the correct window: instant, τLC, burst, or one-sector.

Innovation stays constructive when the window matches the claim.

See [[node:beginners-mind]] and [[node:stewardship-ledger]].

nodes.title: Promise Trials
nodes.excerpt: Promises are proven under separation and pressure.
nodes.bodyMD:
When a mission splits roles, the vow is tested.

One side continues the work. Another side becomes exposed to stress, persuasion, or noise. We measure integrity by what happens next:
- Do we return with proof, or with a story?
- Do we protect the vulnerable, or use them as evidence?

Innovation depends on this. Without trustworthy promises, teams cannot take coherent risks.
